TopicTitle: All versions of ksp crashes (registy fix)

Articles.Content:
I'm used to play ksp with a lot of mod but a few days ago ksp had a strange "crash" whitch still with all my ksp vertion (I have backups of all my previous install) so I deleted the whole ksp folder on steam (using steam first then manually) and downloaded it again but the bug stay here

What I have is a tiny and flat window an error message on my screen (witch is at the end of the output log btw) but no crash report

Here is the output log

I was making a mod so please help me

using window 7

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-09T21:31:42Z" title="03/09/2015 09:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 9, 2015</time> by BenjiGH**

This looks like KSP is having trouble with the graphics:

> 
> D3D device reset failed [E\_INVALIDARG]
> (Filename: Line: 357)
> 
> Switching to resolution 154x0 failed, trying lower one
> 
> All resolution switches have failed
> 
> Screen: could not switch resolution (154x0 fs=0 hz=0)

"D3D device reset failed" is unusual, if you're alt+tabbing during load I'd use Windowed mode or alt+enter instead, maybe reinstall the graphics drivers if it continues.

"Switching to resolution 154x0 failed, trying lower one" this could mean your registry entry for KSP's screen size got corrupted, you can find it in HKEY\_CURRENT\_USER/Software/Squad/Kerbal Space Program

If you set both values to decimal and set width to 1024 and height to 768 it should work.

How do I open the HKEY\_CURRENT\_USER/Software/Squad/Kerbal Space Program directory ?

I'm a noob with computer (at least the way they work)

And I was not alt-tabbing during the load

If you're in any way unsure about editing the Windows registry it's best to leave it alone to be honest, so try deleting the settings.cfg in the KP folder and see if it starts ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Can you please try reinstalling your graphics drivers and rebooting the computer ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I am reinstalling the drivers but just in case tell me more about the other procedure (I have sbdy who can help me here he is a developper)

- - - Updated - - -

Reinstall didn't work

SOLVED :-D

We've done the changes in the registry
Woohoo, I just saw you'd posted, congrats BenjiGH ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Congrat to my room-mate he made the changes to the registry
